newsitem.title: CHINA: Dow Chem in China trading joint venture.
newsitem.headline: Dow Chem in China trading joint venture.

text.p: A wholly-owned subsidiary of U.S. chemical giant Dow Chemical Co and a Chinese partner will set up a joint venture trading firm in China, the Xinhua news agency said on Friday.

Dow China Trading Co and state-owned Shenzhen Aokangde Co would set up a joint venture to import and export petroleum, chemical, mechanical, electronic and light industrial products, textiles and garments, Xinhua said.
The joint venture would have registered capital of 100 million yuan ($12 million), with Dow China Trading holding a 49 percent stake, it said.
The joint venture was forecast to have annual sales of $200 million in the first few years of operation, the agency said.
Its sales would soar to $1.0 billion and profits would reach 1.3 billion yuan in five years, Xinhua said. It gave no further details.
